decks.notes: The deck focuses on combining aggressive playstyle with disruptive elements to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and efficient threats to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and card advantage in longer games. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while ensuring consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruption.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on maximizing damage output through efficient creatures and burn spells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cards like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage to remove blockers and push through damage. The deck also includes cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Burst Lightning to control the board and maintain pressure. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful burn spells, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and secure victory.

This deck is focused on quickly building up devotion to green and using that devotion to power up various green spells and creatures. By ramping up with cards like Elvish Mystic and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner helps to draw cards and untap creatures for additional value. Additionally, cards like Storm the Festival and Lair of the Hydra provide additional threats and flexibility in the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to slow down the opponent's strategy and disrupt their plans through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils. By controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Extinction Event, as well as constantly drawing cards with Narset and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out in a long game. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage with its blink ability.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful red aggro cards to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By including Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck enhances its damage output. With a mix of burn spells like Wild Slash, Play with Fire, and Boltwave, along with efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, consistent damage. The inclusion of Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provides additional burn damage, while Ramunap Ruins serves as a consistent source of damage late in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw cards and gain card advantage to control the game. It includes a variety of lands to ensure it can cast the multicolored spells in the deck. The inclusion of Bring to Light allows the player to search for specific cards they need at any given moment. The deck also contains removal spells and versatile threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation to maintain board control. Additionally, the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage.

The main strategy of this Gruul Aggro deck revolves around playing aggressive creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using instant spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the opponent's board and deal direct damage. The deck also includes cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage to pump up your creatures for even more damage. Additionally, the deck has some protection with cards like Snakeskin Veil and Innkeeper's Talent to keep your creatures alive and ensure maximum damage output. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and using pump spells to deal damage efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with hasty creatures and burn spells, pushing for aggressive plays and finishing the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck utilizes a mix of creature abilities and direct damage spells to maintain pressure and control the pace of the game, aiming to close out games swiftly with a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

The key concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost evasive creatures like Ornithopter and Moon-Circuit Hacker, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Satoru, the Infiltrator. The deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Thousand-Faced Shadow, backed up by efficient removal spells like Dokuchi Silencer. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to both blue and black mana sources.

The deck focuses on using the Greasefang Parhelion combo to generate immense value and create a dominant board state. It includes cards that help control the opponent's hand, disrupt their strategy, and remove threats efficiently. The key strategy is to set up the combo pieces while maintaining control of the game through removal and disruption spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful synergy between Greasefang and Parhelion II, creating a difficult-to-stop engine that can quickly take over the game.
